1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremiah J Roberts is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremiah J Roberts was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To sentence that the defendant is currently serving in Winnebago County Case #14CF390.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant may not have contact with any minor children.

The defendant is to participate in sexual programs offered in the prison system.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

No Costs.

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in custody.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:35 PM. Court does have new Amended Information that was filed today by State, states changes in the Information. Burns understands the Amended Information. Burns, matter has been resolved, has plea questionnaire and defendant understands maximum/minimum sentence, also agreed on jail credit and that the prison would be concurrent to any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving. Court has plea questionnaire, indicates a G plea to count #2 of Amended Information and Count #1 will be dismissed. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court gives felony rights, no possession of firearms or body armor and no voting rights. Court finds the defendant G on count #2 on Amended Information and dismisses count #1. State - have complied with victim notification requirements with no requests or VIS. Court makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 25 years in prison and Court to determine time on ES, concurrent to any sentence he is currently serving, no certain ES conditions suggested. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation of 25 years in prison - credit for 279 days (stipulated). Roberts makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - 32 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 25 years of initial confinement followed by 7 years of ES, concurrent to sentence the defendant is currently serving (Winnebago County Case #14CF390), not eligible for any challenge incarceration programs and conditions of ES: sexual programs, no contact with any minor children, no costs, submit DNA sample, credit for 279 days

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not called on the record. No order to produce. Court will adjourn FPT. State to prepare writ.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in court/custody with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.   JBC appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:02 am. Judge Habeck appearing from Shawano County via phone. Burns PH being waived - faxed to Shawano County by Burns. Court goes thru waiver of preliminary hearing and finds that defendant is waiving his right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. State will be filing INFO within 24 hours and will mirror complaint. Proceed to ARGN Burns enters NG to all charges if information mirrors complaint. State files INFO (mirrors complaint). 8/25/15 @ 1 pm for FPT. Burns would like motion heard at this time. Burns concerned with time frame of allegation for stated reasons. JBC makes statement regarding alleged occurance date and will probably file amended information for the time line and believes that Burns concerns are founded. Court believes amended information would help. Court believes no specific order on the location that incident happened for stated reasons. Believes that discovery will help with the issue of the location and asks both attorneys to look at the discovery and see if they can get location more accurate and court would be willing to hear the motion again. JBC will be here for the August 25th date. Adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
motion to make more specific-to be heard same time as preliminary hearing 5/19/15 at 11:00 am

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:32 AM. Roberts does not have complaint but Burns does. Court reads charges and penalties. Roberts understands charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH.  State - bond - $10,000 cash bond for stated reasons. Burns - bond - makes statement. Court - bond - $10,000.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with any child under the age of 18. State may need to prepare WRIT/Order to Produce.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
